paper_metadata.title: ICTs and Poverty Reduction in Kenya

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: ICTs contributed to improvement of people's lives through enhanced human capital in terms of valuable knowledge and skills, increase in income, reduction in vulnerability, and having a voice in how they are governed
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: data gathered in December 2007 and March 2008 through quantitative and qualitative methods

bonus_information.qualitative_evidence_citation: data gathered in December 2007 and March 2008 through quantitative and qualitative methods

evidence_citations.country_citation: ICTs play a very critical role in poverty reduction in both urban and rural areas in Kenya
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: All people, including those from households classified as poor, access and use ICTs, although the extent of use varies
